title: Cartoonish romantic Valentine page with evasive “No” and “Yes” reveal (meme + love letter)

requirements.text: Update the standalone page at frontend/public/valentine.html to be a simple, romantic-themed, single-purpose Valentine prompt that asks “Will you be my Valentine, my love?” with exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”, optimized for iPad Chrome.

quotes: Create an interactive web page as a surprise for my girlfriend. The page should be simple, romantic-themed, and have only one purpose: to ask her to be my Valentine my love . There should be two options: Yes or No. ... and be fully interactive using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript so that I can easily run it on my iPad using Chrome1

acceptanceCriteria: Opening /public/valentine.html shows a single Valentine question with only two buttons: Yes and No.
Layout is readable and usable on tablet-sized screens (iPad) without horizontal scrolling.
All user-visible copy in this page is in English.

requirements.text: Implement the evasive “No” behavior on the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html): when the user hovers over or touches the “No” button, it moves to a new random position within its container so it cannot be clicked, while ensuring it does not overlap the “Yes” button.

quotes: When she hovers her cursor over No, it should move away so she cannot click it, forcing her to click only on Yes.

acceptanceCriteria: On desktop: moving the cursor over the No button causes it to jump to a different position.
On touch devices (iPad): attempting to press the No button causes it to move away (preventing a click).
No button stays within the visible bounds of its button area and does not overlap the Yes button.
The No button cannot be reliably clicked through normal interaction.

requirements.text: On “Yes” click, show a celebration/reveal view (in both frontend/public/valentine.html and frontend/src/App.tsx) that displays: (1) the meme-style image with embedded text “You are my forever, Warda.” and (2) the full love letter message content provided by the user, formatted as readable paragraphs in a scrollable layout suitable for iPad Chrome.

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her “you are my forever warda ... and write i love you warda ill forever love you , you are my life and i would like to say My love, every day with you feels like a gift...

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking Yes hides the question view and shows the reveal view.
Reveal view includes the meme image and the full love letter text (as paragraph blocks) and is readable on iPad (comfortable font size/line height).
Reveal view content is vertically scrollable so long text is accessible.
The same end-user behavior exists in the React app (frontend/src/App.tsx) and the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html).

requirements.text: Apply a consistent cartoonish romantic visual theme across both the standalone page (frontend/public/valentine.html) and the React flow (frontend/src/App.tsx): warm pink/red palette, playful rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows, and a friendly cartoon-like typographic feel, while keeping the UI simple and focused on the single Valentine question and reveal.

quotes: thia page should be cartonish themed romantically scheme

acceptanceCriteria: Both flows (standalone HTML page and React app) share a coherent cartoonish-romantic styling approach (colors, rounded shapes, heart accents, soft shadows).
Theme does not introduce extra features beyond the Valentine prompt and the reveal view.
Typography and spacing remain readable on mobile/tablet.

requirements.text: Add the meme-style image as a static asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and reference it from both frontend/public/valentine.html and frontend/src/App.tsx using the exact filename valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png (do not serve images through the backend).

quotes: When she clicks Yes, show her a meme image telling her “you are my forever warda

acceptanceCriteria: The file frontend/public/assets/generated/valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png exists and is loadable in the browser.
frontend/public/valentine.html references the image via a relative path that works when opening the file via the app’s static hosting.
No backend endpoints are added for image delivery.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them only).
Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Keep all backend logic within the single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo (no additional backend services).
nonGoals: Adding user accounts, saving responses, analytics, or any server-side persistence.
Adding additional pages or flows beyond the Valentine question and the Yes-reveal.
Integrating third-party auth providers (only Internet Identity is available, and it is not required for this page).

required: Meme-style cartoon romantic illustration with a couple, hearts/sparkles, warm pink/red palette, playful vector-like outlines, and embedded text “You are my forever, Warda.” (valentine-meme-forever-warda.dim_1600x900.png)
